thread.title: Kim Jong-nam murder: North Korea says Malaysia is to blame for death of its citizen
thread.title_full: Kim Jong-nam murder: North Korea says Malaysia is to blame for death of its citizen

author: Jack Kim
title: Kim Jong-nam murder: North Korea says Malaysia is to blame for death of its citizen
text:
Kim Jong-nam murder: North Korea says Malaysia is to blame for death of its citizen Jack Kim twitter TWEET More 
Seoul: North Korea said on Thursday Malaysia was to blame for the death of its citizen there last week and accused the Malaysian government of demonstrating "unfriendly attitude" under a scenario drawn up by South Korea. 
Malaysia had initially informed the North that the person bearing a diplomatic passport had died of a heart attack at Kuala Lumpur airport on February 13, the North's KCNA news agency said. SHARE Kim Jong-nam, left, and his half-brother, North Korean dictator Kim Jong-un. Photo: AP 
North Korea denies the person who died of apparent poisoning by two women was Kim Jong-nam, estranged half brother of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un. 
Mr Kim, 46, who was about to fly to Macau, became unwell after two women appeared to wipe a cloth on his face. He died on the way to hospital. Related Content Malaysia calls North Korea 'delusional' over Kim Jong-nam assassination case 
South Korean and US officials believe Kim Jong-nam, was killed by agents of North Korea. 
On Wednesday, Malaysian police named two North Koreans they want to interview in connection with death : a diplomat and an airline employee. Several others are in custody in Kuala Lumpur including a Vietnamese woman, an Indonesian woman, and a North Korean chemist. SHARE
